SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.controller

Class ControllerState

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.controller.ControllerState
Direct Known Subclasses:
CreationState, FinishingState, InPauseState, OnGoingState
public abstract class ControllerState extends Object
This Class is used to describe the State Pattern employed in the implementation of the GameController.

    Field
    Description

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    ControllerState(GameController controller)
    Sets a GameController as ControllerState, in order to link the controller itself to the states of the Game.

    • changeTurn

      public abstract void changeTurn(String gamesStoragePath, String gamesStoragePathBackup)
      Change the turn in the context of the present state through its implementations.
      Parameters:
      gamesStoragePath - path in which are stored the games
      gamesStoragePathBackup - backup path in which are stored the games
      See Also:
      • CreationState.changeTurn(String, String)

    • insertUserInputIntoModel

      public abstract void insertUserInputIntoModel(Choice playerChoice) throws WrongInputDataException
      Through its various implementations, allows the Player to insert Tiles, in a given order (contained in Choice) into the Board .
      Parameters:
      playerChoice - the choice made by the player.
      Throws:
      WrongInputDataException - thrown when input data is not valid
      See Also:
      • CreationState.insertUserInputIntoModel(Choice)
      • FinishingState.insertUserInputIntoModel(Choice)
      • OnGoingState.insertUserInputIntoModel(Choice)

    • sendPrivateMessage

      public abstract void sendPrivateMessage(String receiver, String sender, String content)
      This method implementations allows to send private messages in different states to a specified Player.
      Parameters:
      receiver - the receiver of the private message.
      sender - the sender of the broadcast Message.
      content - the text of the message.

      public abstract void addPlayer(String nickname) throws LobbyIsFullException
      This method implementation in the different states enables the possibility to add new players to the current Game.

      Throws:
      LobbyIsFullException - if the lobby is full

      public abstract void chooseNumberOfPlayerInTheGame(int chosenNumberOfPlayers)

    • checkExceedingPlayer

      public abstract void checkExceedingPlayer(int chosenNumberOfPlayers) throws ExcessOfPlayersException, WrongInputDataException
      Checks if the number of players in the current lobby is exceeding the game's set number of players through its various implementations.
      Parameters:
      chosenNumberOfPlayers - number of players chosen by the first player.
      Throws:
      ExcessOfPlayersException - signals an excess in the player's number.
      WrongInputDataException - occurs when data has an unexpected value.
      See Also:
      • CreationState.checkExceedingPlayer(int)
      • OnGoingState.checkExceedingPlayer(int)
      • FinishingState.checkExceedingPlayer(int)
      • InPauseState.checkExceedingPlayer(int)

    • startGame

      public abstract void startGame(int numberOfCommonGoalCards)
      Method that permit to start the game through its different implementation controls that all the necessary preparing has been done due to initiating the Game.
      Parameters:
      numberOfCommonGoalCards - number of common goal card from which extract the common goal used during the game
      See Also:
      • CreationState.startGame(int)
      • FinishingState.startGame(int)
      • OnGoingState.startGame(int)
      • InPauseState.startGame(int)

    • disconnectPlayer

      public abstract void disconnectPlayer(String nickname)
      The implementation of this method in the different states enacts the disconnection of a Player.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the disconnecting player.
      See Also:

    • restoreGameForPlayer

      public abstract void restoreGameForPlayer(GameListener server, String nickname, String gamesStoragePath)
      Restores the current game for the considered player.
      Parameters:
      server - the server to which the model notifies its changes.
      nickname - player's nickname that requested the restore.
      gamesStoragePath - the path where are stored the games.
      See Also:
      • Player
      • Game
